application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use from Commercial, Business and Service (Use Class E) to Dwellinghouses (Use Class C3)
description: Prior approval for the change of use from office (Use Class E) to 3 person 2bed dwelling(Use Class C3)
decision_conditions: Under Schedule 2, Part 3, M.2(1)(a) of Class M Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval is required and refused. The proposal would be contrary to, in particular, the aims and objectives of Policy DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy (2012) and Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) owing to its failure to provide satisfactory natural daylight/sunlight to the proposed habitable accommodation. There is no supporting technical evidence submitted as part of this application to otherwise demonstrate that the proposed accommodation would achieve adequate natural light ingress.

Under Schedule 2, Part 3, M.2(1)(a) of Class M Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval is required and refused. The proposal would be contrary to, in particular, the aims and objectives of the Nationally Described Space Standards (2015) and Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) owing to the substandard floor to ceiling height across the proposed accommodation in line with internal space standards set out in Policy D6 of the London Plan 2021.

It has not been demonstrated through the submission of cogent evidence that, on the balance of probability, the building has been in a Class E use for a continuous period of at least 2 years prior to the date of the application for prior approval, contrary to Class MA.1. (1)(b) of Class M Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended).
